required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Fluid Resuscitation Protocol on the Incidence of Reoperation for Bleeding After Emergency Cardiopulmonary Bypass Grafting
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Fluid Resuscitation Protocol on the Incidence of Reoperation for Bleeding After Emergency Cardiopulmonary Bypass Grafting

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective data analysis of patients that underwent elective or emergency cardiopulmonary bypass. Resternotomy due to bleeding is frequent after sternotomy. Also due to implementation of Argipressin into clinical practice fluid resuscitation protocol has changed to more vasopressors and less fluid within the past five years. The investigators want to explore the influence of volume resuscitation protocol on incidence of rethoracotomy during the past twenty years.

primary_outcome.description: Resternotomy yes or no after elective or emergency aortocoronary bypass

intervention.description: No intervention is performed. Reasons for resternotomy (coagulation, fluid balance and other) are retrospectively assessed.

intervention.intervention_name: Assessment of reason for avoidance of resternotomy
intervention.description: No intervention is performed. Reasons for avoidance resternotomy (coagulation, fluid balance and other) are retrospectively assessed.

study_pop.textblock: All patients that underwent elective or emergency aortocoronary bypass.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients that underwent elective or emergency aortocoronary bypass at the University Hospital Basel between 2009 and 2020.
Exclusion Criteria:
- None.
